definition: to move with a lurch, stagger
examples: has lurched from crisis to crisis

definition: to roll or tip abruptly : pitch
an abrupt jerking, swaying, or tipping movement, stagger sense 2
examples: the car moved forward with a lurch

definition: a sudden roll of a ship to one side
a decisive defeat in which an opponent wins a game by more than double the defeated player's score especially in cribbage
in a vulnerable and unsupported position
examples: At the peak of the noonday rush the cashier stalked out and left him in the lurch.

definition: to defeat by a lurch (as in cribbage)
to loiter about a place furtively : prowl
